name: hippunfold
author: Khan Computational Imaging Lab
description: BIDS App for Hippunfold. Please cite: Automated hippocampal unfolding for morphometry and subfield segmentation with HippUnfold.  Jordan DeKraker, Roy AM Haast, Mohamed D Yousif, Bradley Karat, Jonathan C Lau, Stefan KÃ¶hler, Ali R Khan. eLife (2022).  https://doi.org/10.7554/eLife.77945

inputs.description: subject folder for BIDS (folders name should be sub-XXXXX).
inputs.name: subject_dir

inputs.description:
Type of image to run hippunfold on, prefixed
with seg will import an existing hippocampal tissue
segmentation from that space, instead of running
neural network (default: ['T2w'])
inputs.name: modality

inputs.description: Path to the derivatives folder (e.g. for finding manual segs) (default: False)
inputs.name: derivatives

inputs.description: Set this flag if your inputs (e.g. T2w, dwi) are already pre-processed (default: False)
inputs.name: skip_preproc

inputs.description: Set this flag if your inputs (e.g. T2w, dwi) are already registered to T1w space (default: False)
inputs.name: skip_coreg

inputs.description: Set this flag to skip post-processing template injection into CNN segmentation (default: False)
inputs.name: skip_inject_template_labels

inputs.description: Scales the default smoothing sigma for gradient and warp in template shape injection. Using a value higher than 1 will use result in a smoother warp, and greater capacity to patch larger holes in segmentations. Try setting to 2 if nnunet segmentations have large holes. Note: the better solution is to re-train network on the data you are using (default: 1.0)
inputs.name: inject_template_smoothing_factor

inputs.description:
Use rigid instead of affine for registration to
template. Try this if your images are reduced FOV
(default: False)
inputs.name: rigid_reg_template

inputs.description:
Use if input data is already in space-CITI168
(default: False)
inputs.name: no_reg_template

inputs.description: Set the template to use for registration to coronal oblique. (default: CITI168)
inputs.name: template

inputs.description: Select the atlas (unfolded space) to use for subfield labels. (default: bigbrain)
inputs.name: atlas

inputs.description: Use T1w to register to template space, instead of the segmentation modality. Note: this was the default behavior prior to v1.0.0. (default: False)
inputs.name: t1_reg_template

inputs.description: Enable test-time augmentation for nnU-net inference, slows down inference by 8x, but potentially increases accuracy
inputs.name: nnunet_enable_tta

inputs.description: Sets the output space for results
inputs.name: output_spaces

inputs.description: Generate myelin map using T1w divided by T2w, and map to surface with ribbon approach. Requires both T1w and T2w images to be present.
inputs.name: generate_myelin_map

inputs.description:
Sets the output vertex density for results. Options
correspond to approximate vertex spacings of 0.5mm,
1.0mm, and 2.0mm, respectively, with the 32k vertices
option having unequal vertex spacing. (default: ['7k','2k'])
inputs.name: output_density

inputs.description: Hemisphere(s) to process (default: ['L', 'R'])
inputs.name: hemi

inputs.description:
Method to use for laminar coordinates. Equivolume uses
equivolumetric layering from Waehnert et al 2014
(Nighres implementation). (default: ['equivolume'])
inputs.name: laminar_coords_method

inputs.description: Keep work folder intact instead of archiving it for each subject (default: False)
inputs.name: keep_work

inputs.description: Force nnunet model to use (expert option). (default: False)
inputs.name: force_nnunet_model
